main event: A red, silvery object the size of a basketball was observed in the sky over San Antonio, Texas on August 12, 1958.
interesting points: The object was very bright and stationary.
Balloon schedules indicated a balloon was released from the San Antonio Airport around the time of the sighting, and the description was characteristic of a balloon.
The sighting was reported as a Ground-Visual observation from a civilian source.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were cloudy with various temperature and cloud cover details provided.
sighted object: red, silvery object the size of a basketball
photographs: no photographs included in the report
